locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the reality of spiritual warfare, the strategy of Satan (sifting), the context of the Last Supper, and the intercession of Christ for Peter and the believer.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-narrative focus; uses the analogy of political planning to bridge the gap between the text and 20th-century listeners.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of evil and the necessity of vigilance, shifting toward the end to promising the protection of Christ's prayer.
voorbeelden: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you that you are not in this fight by yourself.
Satan has desired to sift you, but I have prayed for you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To alert the congregation to spiritual danger and comfort them with the assurance of Christ's intercession.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is mentioned as the 'Sword of the Spirit' but not explicitly as the agent of the sermon's effect.

voorbeelden: Modern people are willing to see a plan in everything else except evil.
Jesus said bluntly that there is somebody out to get us.
Watch ye, stand fast in the faith.
Do not drowse or settle back.
I am always overborne and shattered within.
I shall wonder and praise him for that.
You are not in this fight by yourself.
You may be shaken, but you will come out all right.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High quality toward the end, specifically the 'toezegging' of Christ's prayer.

voorbeelden: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you...
I appoint unto you a kingdom.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher invokes ministerial authority to declare the promise.

indicatoren: Extensive political analogies about Jimmy Carter and election strategies.
Long descriptions of the Upper Room atmosphere.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the 'plan' of Satan but remains an observer for much of the sermon.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter with the promise until the final third of the text.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly addressed to the 'you' of the congregation.
voorbeelden: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you that you are not in this fight by yourself.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, especially in the final appeal.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply Christ's prayer to the listener.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Satan, Peter, and the political landscape.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about the nature of evil.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the sermon's authority and the current struggle.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the reality of the struggle (Assertive) to the authority of the promise (Commissive/Declarative) to the call to stand (Directive).
voorbeelden: Satan may sift (Assertive) -> I have prayed for you (Commissive) -> Stand therefore (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is effective because the directive is grounded in the promise of Christ's prayer.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because Jesus is pleading our cause, we can stand.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a 'Toezegging' (Promise) that creates a space of safety within a world of spiritual danger.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you...
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes the preacher as a mandatory of God.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the 1976 election strategies.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Distracts from the illocutionary force of the text.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it shifts from 'talking about' Satan to 'proclaiming' Christ's intercession.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' is clear, though delayed by descriptive material.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the quoted words of Jesus applied to the present.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Explicitly claimed in the final section.
tekstueel_bewijs: I have come today armed with the authority...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher trusts the Word to 'arm' the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: Sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon acts as a shield for the hearer.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The 'when' of deliverance is treated as a present reality.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is right now pleading our cause.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Reduce historical/political assertives; increase present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus said bluntly that there is somebody out to get us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I declare to you today: the Enemy is seeking your soul, but he shall not have it.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a report of Jesus' words to a present-tense declaration.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Move the toezegging earlier to frame the struggle.
voorbeeldzinnen: Before we look at the devil's plan, hear this: Christ has already prayed for you.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to implicate the hearer in the danger immediately.
voorbeeldzinnen: Satan has a plan for your life this week.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of how a sermon can move from a lecture on spiritual warfare to a sacramental act of protection.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about help, but is actually 'performing' the help through the promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the Carter analogy (rhetoric), but in the 'I have prayed for you' (illocution).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is a Commissive act where God binds Himself to the listener's safety.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I have come today armed with the authority to say to you that you are not in this fight by yourself.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it transforms the sermon into a sacramental event.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully overcomes its initial constative surplus through a strong performative finish.
